question: Does interleukin-18 signaling contribute causally to the development of atherosclerosis, such that inhibiting IL-18 reduces atherosclerotic lesion formation in mice? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Interruption of IL18 action reduces atherosclerosis in mice.
content.source_2: In Apoe−/− mice, neither combined deficiency of IL18r and NCC nor single deficiency of either protein reduced atherosclerosis compared with Apoe−/− controls.
content.source_3: Circulating IL-18 levels were not associated with carotid intima–media thickness or coronary plaque burden after multivariable adjustment, indicating no independent role for IL-18 in atherogenesis.
